quotes.quote: Between what is said and not meant, and what is meant and not said, most of love is lost.
So the whole war is because we can't talk to each other.
Well, it's really no use our talking in the way we have been doing if the words we use mean something different to each of us...and nothing.
Remember that misuse of language can lead to miscommunication, and that miscommunication leads to everything that has ever happened in the whole of the world
He seemed to think we were on the same page. I wasn’t even sure we were reading the same book.
Often in close relationships, the subject being discussed is not the subject at all.
The only thing for sure we know about communication is that we tend to get it wrong.
The single biggest problem in communication is the illusion that it has taken place.
Avoid miscommunication. The price you pay for it is horrendous.

The overall purpose of human communication is - or should be - reconciliation. It should ultimately serve to lower or remove the walls of misunderstanding which unduly separate us human beings, one from another.

And I got - I got - I got to thinkin' about - about miscommunication. Like, how - isn't that the root of it? Conflict. War - does - doesn't it all come down to - to language? Right? The - the words we say and the words we hear, which aren't always the same thing.
So whatever is on your mind, know you can always say it / Miscommunication, we don't know what we're saying, no / Miscommunication
We seem to have a knack for miscommunication / It stabbed us in the back this time  / Is this the end of the line  / 'cause that'd be a crime
There's a voice that sounds too loud  / It bangs on endlessly / want to live in another world with no frustrations  / And miscommunication
We fall to miscommunication / in that moment I might die / I'll let you go if you really mean it
Miscommunications / Can't ever have no good relations / Do I haunt your mind, am I a waste of time? / Guess I'll just carry on as a ghost
Misinterpretations / We're having differing vibrations / I apologize for all my great white lies
But I'm getting so tired of people always crossing my wires / Life's just far too short for miscommunication.
It's funny how money change a situation / Miscommunication leads to complication / My emancipation don't fit your equation
Oh, a simple complication / Miscommunications lead to fall out / So many things that I wish you knew / So many walls up I can't break through
So this is where the story ends / A conversation on I-M / Well I'm done, were texting / Sorry for the miscommunication
Over a miscommunication that probably could be fixed with a 5 minute conversation, I'm still praying
Try and understand me if I stumble now and then / Some miscommunication stood between both you and I / You made your decision, here's hoping it's the right one
Nothing I can dictate / Where did we go wrong? / We need medication for  / This miscommunication
Why don't you invite them up? / I got a word or two to tell them / It's about the situation / A terrible miscommunication
Try to get my thoughts together / I think of a time when things were better / This miscommunication is breaking me down
Before you speak (before you speak) / Think about what you're trying to say (think about what you're trying to say) / Who else is there to blame for miscommunication?
Do the same even though I had a meaner start / Still a league apart, guess I got a cleaner heart / Miscommunication tore my team apart

Miscommunication means to complication and / Here we are staring at each other at strangers, sleeping in the same bed / 'Cause it's like, you were never taught how to use your words like that / You were never taught how to say loving things and caring things.

Seems like there's a miscommunication / About the way we're all supposed to be / Children of the sun come down and help us to see / That we're all together on a journey sharing universal destinies / Open up your soul and let it run wild and free
